intro: Alsine grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Europe and western Asia. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, succulent stems and small, clustered leaves. Its showy, pink or white flowers bloom in summer, often in dense inflorescences. Alsine grandiflora is adapted to sandy and gravelly soils, and it thrives in environments with low moisture and high sunlight.
